summary: Email correspondence from March 2022 between a DOJ OIG investigator and a former Bureau of Prisons employee regarding the timeline of their role as Acting Facility Manager at MCC New York and the installation of a new camera system. The emails discuss the camera system's purchase in 2018, its scheduled and actual installation dates in 2019, and staffing details, all in the context of the OIG's investigation following the Epstein incident in August 2019.

keyFacts: A new camera system for MCC New York was purchased in September 2018 and estimated to have arrived in October 2018, but was not installed until the week of August 16, 2019, immediately following the Epstein incident on August 10, 2019.

The camera system installation was part of a larger infrastructure project at MCC New York that was scheduled to begin on March 17, 2019, utilizing temporary duty (TDY) staff from other BOP institutions.
The DOJ OIG was investigating the timeline of the Facility Manager's tenure and the camera system installation, indicating scrutiny of BOP procedures and readiness before and after Epstein's death.
Email correspondence reveals coordination between BOP regional staff, facility management, and an external vendor (SigNet Technologies) regarding the camera system procurement and installation.

The document shows the Facility Manager's role was in flux, serving as Acting Facility Manager on a TDY basis starting February 2019, with the permanent manager having left the role prior to retiring in September 2019.
